page.title: 04FARMING
page.content: BURNEWHALL FARM,which is owned by Lord Falmouth,lies in the parish of St Buryan.Burnewhall is farmed by Phil Pengelly and is something of a parish in its own right. As well as Burnewhall,he runs the 150 acre Tower Farm at Sennen where he keeps young dairy stock and beef ,173 beasts all told which together with Burnewhall's herd makes 283 mouths to feed.Yet the business only has a workforce of five:Phil himself,his wife Rosemary as secretary,herdsman Irwin Rowe,tractorman Jeremy Parker and pre_college student Lindsay Sowden.Do they ever sleep..... "We're pretty well organised," Phil says with some understatement: "It's essential to keep the two units independent of each other with just the machinery moving between.
